Recent updates in New York City include a Legionella scare in a Yorkville co-op, critical injuries from a pedestrian accident in Brooklyn, and the implementation of a new tipping transparency law expected to return $550 million to workers. Additionally, a guilty plea was entered by an Indian national for plotting an assassination in NYC.

### Risks & Alerts

- Legionella scare reported in Yorkville co-op; residents advised to monitor health symptoms. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- 71-year-old man critically injured after being struck by SUV in Brooklyn; driver remains at large. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMitgFBVV95cUxPcm42V2dOSk9ZRVNFN3dpX0pGcTk2MjZPc05xNHd5Q1dRamZzdkRBcjNkXzhzN19IOFdzNHlJYkNFYjQtT1VhdWlXZDBpUFBFLTNUeEtMMW0zYTg3X1p4eXYydHVPajRlb2JSMU9NUHBuWWtoc1BKNHh6MXNkZkpoRmdMTWd4dTQ1YWtCWl80WnkxdWNOTkJ0WkluTjJGSlhBLVJoTTd4UTVOMFNGdERkV3B1cVZBZw?oc=5)
